entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 1:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY... A strong front is expected to affect the area beginning on Friday and continuing through Saturday. Moist, warm air overrunning cold air will result in accumulating snow for most of the panhandle. Snow is expected to spread from the Northeast Gulf Coast down through the panhandle. 4-9 inches is expected to fall over a 24 hour

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 4:53AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WARM TEMPERATURES AND RAIN FOR SOUTHWEST ALASKA... The first of two progressively warmer systems will move across Southwest Alaska from west to east today and tonight, bringing gusty southerly winds, coastal rain and interior snow. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued February 21 at 3:32PM CST until February 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 10:15AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER ACROSS CENTRAL AND EASTERN VIRGINIA TODAY... Westerly winds will gust up to 25 to 35 mph across central and eastern Virginia from midday to early this evening. These breezy and warm conditions will result in minimum RH values of 20 to 30 percent across the area. This, along with drying fuels, will result in an Increased Fire Danger across the area.
